project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3607].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is only possible to use {{.png}} & {{.jpg}} images for request types in JIRA Service Desk. It would be useful is {{.svg}} files could be allowed as well.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow {{.svg}} images to be uploaded.

h3. Workaround 
Use {{.png}} & {{.jpg}} images.
fields.summary: Allow usage of .SVG images for request types

I received a strange error when logging in this morning as seen here: http://www.screencast.com/t/Q9spjgXtOp

I then reset my password and received the same error.  I was able to finally get to the projects page, but when I select our Service Desk, I receive the same error.  Below is the error detail from the screenshot above.

fields.description:
h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk 3.0+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a customer Portal
# Add a user to be the System Administrator
# Add this user as a member to jira-servicedesk-users
# Browse to the customer portal
# Remove the Sys Admin from the jira-servicedesk-users and try to browse to the customer portal
# The sysadmin will see "You don't have permission to access any Customer Portal"

h3. Expected Results
The System Administrator should be able to access the customer portal as a regular customer.

h3. Actual Results
It throws the access error.

h3.Workaround
JIRA Admins can be added to jira-core-users or jira-software-users, so that the Service Desk license will be saved as intended.
fields.summary: System Admin must be member of application to see customer portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3596].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Other than vertical positioning of fields, it is not possible to make any adjustments to the layout of the create request screen for Service Desk. When working with request types that require a lot of fields to be filled in, this means the create screen can become really long stretched downwards.

h3. Suggested Solution
Being able to place fields in columns provides the option to place fields next to each other instead of under each other. This helps to create a better looking layout.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to be able to adjust the layout of the create issue screen

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3595].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an Agent, I frequently markup my responses to customers, and in doing use wiki markup that looks especially good in the JIRA view of support tickets. I always use the blue Preview button ( !preview.png|thumbnail! ) to make sure my editing looks the way I intend.

However, this does not apply to the Customer Portal view that my customer's see. Sometimes, the results are impossible for my customers to read or understand, making for a poor customer support experience.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a Customer Portal preview button, so that I can format my customer responses to show what they are seeing, so that I can build my responses in a format that's easier for my intended audience to read and more importantly understand. The Customer Portal view is so vastly different from the standard JIRA view of a support issue, that being able to see what the customer will see is essential to formatting a customer response in a way that is readable for them.
 
h3. Workaround 
I have to reformat the support issue's URL to add this: {{/servicedesk/customer/portal/XX/}} so that I can switch to the customer's view of the issue - but only AFTER it's been added to the ticket. Editing this view will result in more mail being sent to the customer, which is also not a good customer support experience.
fields.summary: Customer Portal Preview

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an Agent uses a \{code\} formatting block in a response the text inside it does not wrap. Instead the text breaks out of the layout and off the right side of the screen/window.

h3. Environment
* support.atlassian.com, JIRA 6.4.11 / Service Desk 2.4.3
* extranet.atlassian.com/jira, JIRA 7.1.3 / Service Desk 3.1.3
* Confirmed affected browsers are Chrome 49.0.2623.87 (64 bit), Firefox 43.0.4. 
* Confirmed not-affected browsers are Safari Version 8.0.7 (10600.7.12), Chrome 48.0.2564.116 (64 bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As an Agent, add a comment.
# In the comment add the following markup, minus the back slashes: {code}
\{code\}
test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test test 
\{code\}
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The best result would be to show these blocks should be shown with scrollbars in combination with a max-width+max-height as they are in the JIRA Core views. This matches the way they are shown in the Agent view and JIRA Core view.

If this is not feasible then text inside block elements should wrap and visible text should not overlap other elements.

h3. Actual Results

* Text continues past the boundary of the code/pre block, past the layout div, and off the right side of the page.
* The text can overlap links, preventing them from being clicked:
!SD-CodeFormatting-bug.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes

* The \{noformat\} macro is also affected.
* Attempted wrapping the \{code\} block in a \{panel\} block but his does not change the result.

h3. Workaround

Insert line breaks into your \{code\} block every 60 characters. For example, this can be done with BBEdit using *Text > Hard Wrap...*.
fields.summary: code and noformat text does not wrap in some browser versions, breaking layout

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Request types on the "Recentés" section on the Service Desk Customer Portal on French are showing as unencoded HTML if its name contains an apostrophe.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Service Desk Project, then create a request type with at least one apostrophe,
# Access the Customer Portal, then create a request with this type,
# Click on "Centre de support" to go back to the initial screen.

h3. Expected Results
The request type shows normally under the "Recentés" section.

h3. Actual Results
Unencoded HTML shows up instead of the apostrophes.

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no workaround other than remove the apostrophes.
fields.summary: "Recentés" section on Customer Portal shows unencoded HTML if the request type contains apostrophes

fields.description:
{panel:title=Resolution}
Customer Notifications will be available in new releases which eliminates the need for this dark feature:
* JSD-218 - already released in Cloud
* JSD-4418 - coming soon in Server
{panel}

h4. +Summary+
JIRA Service Desk allows to disable the new email notification template by enabling this dark feature:
{code}sd.email.conversational.notification.disabled{code}
By doing this, JIRA Service Desk will use the old email notification template; however, Satisfaction Survey stops working.

h4. +Steps to Reproduce+
# Go to <JIRA_URL>/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
# Add this dark feature to disable the new email notification template:
bq. sd.email.conversational.notification.disabled
# Enable Satisfaction Survey from Project Settings
# Create a request and resolve it
# Check email notification

h4. +Expected Result+
Satisfaction Survey is sent with the email

h4. +Actual Result+
Satisfaction Survey is missing

h4. +Workaround+
Disable the dark feature enabled in step 2 above
fields.summary: Customer satisfaction Survey doesn't work with old email notification template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3589].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create two Service Desk projects.
# Invite a customer to the first one, via the "Invite Customers" button on the Customers section of the service desk.
# Follow the invite link that's sent and sign up for an account.
# On the second service desk, send an invite to the same account.

The email from the second service desk is sent as normal, but when the user follows the link they get a "Token is either expired or not valid" error on the resulting page.

If a customer already exists in a different service desk, there should be some popup that notifies the user that this is the case, adds them to the service desk as normal, and sends a different notification to the customer to let them know they now have access to the new one (as opposed to sending another signup link).
fields.summary: Customer accounts that already exist are still sent an invite email when inviting them to a second service desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3588].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition:*
When Request Participants are added into a case, a lot of unnecessary email notifications are getting triggered to those user, which makes JSD a very annoying and noisy toll for the client that we are dealing with.

*Solution:*
We need to have the ability to disable the notifications of the Request Participants field from the Notifications Scheme like any other field.
fields.summary: Disable Notifications Triggered by Request Participants Field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3587].
  {panel}

The "Setting up request types" documentation includes a section on "Hidden fields and unsupported fields" that includes a partial list of fields that cannot be shown in the portal. 

This suggestion is to update the list of fields to include all fields that cannot be shown in the customer portal. 

----

In Service Desk 3.1.2, the following fields are available in the portal: 

{quote}
* Checkboxes
** description: Choose multiple values using checkboxes.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multicheckboxes
* Date Picker
** description: A custom field that stores dates and uses a date picker to view them
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datepicker
* Date Time Picker
** description: A custom field that stores dates with a time component
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datetime
* Labels
** description: Add arbitrary labels to issues.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:labels
* Number Field
** description: A custom field that stores and validates numeric (floating point) input.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:float
* Radio Buttons
** description: A list of radio buttons
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:radiobuttons
* Select List (cascading)
** description: Choose multiple values using two select lists.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:cascadingselect
* Select List (multiple choices)
** description: Choose multiple values in a select list.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiselect
* Select List (single choice)
** description: A single select list with a configurable list of options.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:select
* Text Field (multi-line)
** description: A multiline text area custom field to allow input of longer text strings.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea
* Text Field (single line)
** description: A basic single line text box custom field to allow simple text input.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textfield
* URL Field
** description: Allow the user to input a single URL
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:url
* User Picker (single user)
** description: Choose a user from the user base via a popup picker window.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:userpicker
* User Picker (multiple users)
** description: Choose multiple users from the user base via a popup picker window.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiuserpicker
{quote}

The following fields are not able to be added to the customer portal. These can be added to a request type if they are hidden and have a preset value.

{quote}
* Group Picker (multiple groups)
** description: Choose multiple user groups using a popup picker window.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multigrouppicker
* Group Picker (single group)
** description: Choose a user group using a popup picker window.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:grouppicker
* Project Picker (single project)
** description: Choose from projects that the user can view in the system.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:project
* Version Picker (multiple versions)
** description: Choose from available versions in the project.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiversion
* Version Picker (single version)
** description: Choose a single version from available versions in the project.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:version
{quote}
fields.summary: Update "Setting up request types" documentation to list standard custom field types that cannot be shown in portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3583].
  {panel}

Currently when creating a knowledge base in the JSD customer portal, you can limit access to articles in a space by adding labels that can be searched by customers, as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html]:

bq.Limit the pages that will be suggested - In the Restrict to articles with label column, enter the labels that must be applied to pages in order for them to appear in the suggested page list. For example, you might want to only include pages with the label "purchasing" to appear when customers enter a "Request new software" request.

It would be helpful if users could restrict access to certain pages based on label, as well as including labels that can be searched. 

Additionally, it would be useful if the restricted labels also applied to the general search option in the customer portal so that when users search prior to submitting a ticket, results can be further filtered.
fields.summary: Restrict access to labels in JSD customer knowledgebase

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

When a user tries to reorder the queue of a Service Desk project and presses {{Edit Queue}} button, the user is unable to drag the columns around even though the arrow shows they should be able to on *Microsoft Edge* when using *JIRA Service Desk 3.1.2*

*How to replicate*
# Install JIRA 7.1.0 along with JIRA Service Desk 3.1.2
# Create a new Service Desk project.

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 10 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

We will be closing this suggestion as it is duplicated by JSDSERVER-3371 which has a significantly higher number of votes and comments. Please vote for and watch the other ticket for future updates.

Kind regards,

Charlie

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center
{panel}
Service Desk currently allows to display image attachments embedded in the notification emails that are being sent from Service Desk.
Non-image files however can not get embedded.
In these cases, a customer is required to have access to the portal in order to fetch the files in question.
In certain situations, it will not be possible for customers to reach the portal, and all Service Desk functionality will go through email instead.
This can happen both when the customers environment does not allow access to outside networks, or if the network where JIRA Service Desk is hosted does not allow incoming traffic from outside the network.

h3. Note
File attachments on mail servers often are subject to a size restriction. If there is a mismatch between the size that Service Desk allows to get attached, and the mail server allows to process, there could surface some issues
fields.summary: Embed non-image attachments files in the notification email.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When changing screens in a Service Desk project between an issue from the queue, and any other page within the same section, after opening an issue beyond the first one, the page header will remain stuck on the issue key of any of the issues opened beyond the first one. This can cause very inconvenient situations, in particular when working with JIRA Service Desk in multiple tabs at the same time.

h3. Environment
So far this has been tested and confirmed in any combination of JIRA 7.1.x and Service Desk 3.1.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project
# Create multiple issues in the Service Desk project
# Navigate to the project from the Projects dropdown menu in the top navigation bar, which leads you to {{baseurl/projects/project-key/queues}}
# Open an issue from the queue. Note the browser tab adapting to the issue key that has been opened
# Open any other option from the screen, like reverting back to the queues. Note the browser tab adapting the actual page again on which you are located
# Open another issue from the queue and revert back to another page for a couple of times

h3. Expected Results
With each navigation, the expected result is that the page header (as displayed in the browser tab) adjusts to display the actual page the browser is displaying.

h3. Actual Results
Once the replication steps have been performed a couple of times, the browser header will continuously display an issue key, regardless of the page that you are on.
The first time after navigating away from an issue, the header will get adjusted accordingly, however on any of the subsequent replication steps, the header can get stuck on the issue key you navigate to in that particular step.

The exception is, that when you navigate to another issue key than the one that is stuck in the header, the header *will* change to properly reflect this. However, if you navigate to any other page within the project from that point onwards, the header will return to the initial issue key at which the issue surfaced.

h3. Notes
The replication of this issue is inconsistent in the fact that it can take multiple attempts to make the bug surface. It can happen on the 2nd attempt or any of the following attempts, where it never took more than a handful of them for me to replicate this.

This issue has been replicated in Chrome, Firefox and Microsoft Edge (Though Edge is not officially supported). Circumventing proxies and clearing browser caches have not provided any different behaviour.

h3.Workaround
The only option to work around this, is to hard refresh the page. However, after doing so, the issue might resurface within a few navigations.
fields.summary: Page header when navigating to an issue from within Service Desk does not change

h3. Summary
When a Confluence KB Space is linked to a Service Desk project, the Table of Contents Macro is not displayed on any page containing the macro when viewing from the Customer Portal as a Customer.

h3. Environment

* JIRA v7.2.0-OD-03-014
* Confluence 6.0.0-OD-2016.11.1-1091

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding or editing a comment in a new tab in JIRA Service Desk issues, navigating away from the page without any changes made still generates the Confirm Navigation dialog:
{code}
***

You have entered new data on this page. If you navigate away from this page without first saving your data, the changes will be lost.

***

Are you sure you want to leave this page?
{code}
Screenshot: [^ConfirmNavigation.png]

h3. Environment

* JIRA Service Desk 3.1.2 with JIRA 7.1.1
* Affected browsers: IE11, Chrome, Firefox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any Service Desk issue. 
# Right-click on the Comment button and open in a new tab, or right-click the Edit button for an existing comment an open in a new tab.
# In the Comment screen, close the page directly or click on "Cancel" to go back to the issue.

h3. Expected Results
Nothing happens and you can navigate back to the view issue screen.

h3. Actual Results
The browser thinks that new data has been added, and throws a dialog: [^ConfirmNavigation.png] 
 
h3. Notes
* Only happens on *Service Desk projects*. Software and Core are not affected.
* Does not happen if you add a comment directly in the View Issue screen, or edit a comment directly. Only happens if you do it through a new tab.

h3.Workaround
Do not edit or add comments in a new tab.
fields.summary: Confirm Navigation browser dialog appears when adding or editing comments in new tab even if no changes were made

  {panel}

Hello,

We use Jira for project management, time reporting and ticket management. 
Obviously, the service deck app is an important tool for my helpdesk team. We have more than one hundred accounts and most of them are big companies. 

Consequently, we have customers from different companies using the customer portal. But we are loosing times on two points due to the customer management. 

*+Creating ticket with the good account+*
When a customer open an issue through the portal, the account isn't indicated, even if I previously associated the account and the customer on the tempo settings.
How is it possible to do such a things ? 

*+Getting contact info+*
When a customer open a ticket, we have absolutly no contact info except the mail, by clicking on reporter's link. 
On the customer managament screeen, I can't indicate any contact info such as basically a phone number. 
Consequently, we need to connect on our CRM to get the contact info. Difficult for me to explain to my CEO why we take Jira rather the CRM's helpddesk tool.

Could you help on those two points making my helpdesk team happy and efficient when getting ticket from the customer portal ? 

Best regards,
Fabien Ducher
fields.summary: [Service desk] customer contact details

  {panel}

Our SD has multiple user directories configured. Most users (incl. customers) are managed in Active Directory. Within Active Directory we enforce a number of password rules.

When a customer has forgotten his password, he can request to reset his password, which results in the generic SD "Password Reset Request" email. If the user then clicks the link and chooses a new password that does not match our rules, this will fail, but the user does not get any explanation about what was wrong. This leads to frequent identical support request for our IT team from users that get stuck without a login.

Some improvements that could help are:
- Allow us to add custom content to the "Password reset request" email template, so that we can add a link to our password rules.
- Allow us to update the content of the "Change Password" screen, so we can add the link there.
- Improve the integration with AD to cope with custom password rules and provide user friendly errors (I'm not sure this is technically possible).
- Allow us to configure the same password rules as in AD and use these to validate password input.
fields.summary: Improve password reset requests when integrated with AD

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when a user signs up for Service Desk using a specific Customer Portal URL, he is automatically added to and can begin to raise issues on any Service Desk that has customer signup enabled (i.e. all projects that have request security set to "Anyone can sign up for a customer account on my Customer Portal"). This makes it hard to configure Service Desk for scenarios where specific customers should only be able to signup and raise requests on specific portals only, while there are other portals on the same instance that will allow signup for other specific group of customers only. 

The main problem here seems to be the fact that all Service Desk projects are required to have the *Service Desk Customer - Portal Access* granted basic permissions by default e.g. Create Issue, Browse projects etc (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-3421). This makes it hard to restrict these project permissions, except of course by entirely disabling customer self-signups by using request security option: 'Only people on my customers list can raise a request').

h3. Solution
Make request security and public signup more flexible for Service Desk admins who want to allow anyone with a portal URL to be able to signup, but then to only be able to raise issues on the specific portal on which they signed up on, and no other.
fields.summary: More flexible portal-specific customer signup

fields.description:
There seem to be two symptoms with a common cause:

h3. Converting a Private comment to Public
As an Agent, I hit the Share With Customer button to convert a Private comment to a Public comment.  The Comment_Edited event is fired, which is correct, however, it seems that the Event Declaring this change fires before JSD sets the entity properties of the comment that indicate the comments public nature.  This means that Event Listeners would be unable to differentiate between a JSD Private comment and a JSD Private comment that was just Shared, meaning end-users will not be notified about such public features.

h3. Adding a Private comment
We've found that with no other changes, as an Event Listener we receive comments that (a) have no entity properties defined (we see the entity property showing *{{none()}}*) , or (b) have entity properties defined.  One possible explanation is that JSD is updating entity properties in an Event Listener callback, and the Set of Event Listeners notified is not a repeatable sequence:
- If the JSD Event Listener is registered before ours, then the comment entity properties are set and treated as private (b)
- If our Event Listener is registered first, then no properties are found and the comment is treated as public (a)

It would be a race condition driven by the use of Event Listeners to set entity properties.  With no deterministic way to detect JSD private comments in addons, *addons will leak private information*.

The entity property identifying the comment as public must be set before the event is fired to ANY Event Listener.  JSD should create the comment, without firing an event, setup its properties, then fire the event.
fields.summary: Comment entities not set before COMMENT_CREATED  fired, causes Race Condition for addons and event listeners

  {panel}

Jira Service Desk lacks documentation regarding resolution descriptions and best practices.  Using the default {{IT Help}} issue and resolving it, the agent is presented with an {{Issue}} option.

So, is it fairly common that help requests are resolved by filing another issue in a completely separate project for them?  I imagine so.  

However, should the customer request remain open until that issue is fixed?  That doesn't seem feasible or likely to meet an SLA.  Or, has the agent assisted the customer, sufficiently, by filing an issue on their behalf (although it may be quite some time before it is fixed).  I know this is business logic and up to Service Desk Administrators, but this is also a fairly common scenario that I've seen within Atlassian, itself.  It would be nice if there were some documentation suggesting guidelines for agents in regards to resolving requests based on filing other project issues on the customer's behalf.  

And, how will the customer ever track the status of the other issue?  Is this configurable?  Any practices that Service Desk Administrators can follow to allow the customer to see issues filed on their behalf, not just requests?
fields.summary: Service Desk lacks resolution documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
If a User whether it is an agent or customer sending an email with an existing issue key on its subject (or have an intention to comment on an existing ticket), if they don't have the permission to view the ticket due to security level, this misleading "You do not have permission to view this attachment" will shown on the JSD Email Settings "Processing Log"

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a Dummy Service Desk project and set the Mail Channel
# Create a new Issue Security Scheme and set the Security Level as simple as:
## Name: Level 1
## Reporter
## Current Assignee
## agent1
# Assign the scheme to the dummy project.
# As a customer create a ticket
# Back as an agent1, set the security level of that ticket to "Level 1"
# As an agent2 that have the permission to access the project, prepare an email with the issue key as the subject.
# Comment on the mail body and attach a file.
# Send the Email

h3. Expected Result:
* The email will be rejected as the agent2 does not have permission to access the ticket with a message "You do not have permission to view the ticket" on the "Processing Log"

h3. Actual Result:
* The email is rejected with a message "You do not have permission to view this attachment" on the Processing log

h3. Notes:
* Based on my test:
** If there is no attachment, the comment is added even though that user not able to view it.
** If there is an attachment, with the "You do not have permission to view this attachment" the attachment is still added while the comment is not.
fields.summary: You do not have permission to view this attachment

  {panel}

Use case is that, a customer sends an email with an agent CC'd on the message.

*What happens now*

* Agent gets added as a Request Participant, meaning they take on the customer role for ticket

*What should happen*

* Agent remains in agent role

*How can this be done*

* Automation is a good way to do this, but will require conditions to detect WHEN a Request Participant is added, and THEN allow participant to be removed from issue

The final result, might be something like:

* WHEN request participant added
* IF User is an agent
* THEN remove user from participants
fields.summary: Provide automation conditions to allow removal of Request Participants

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3504].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The SLA is not pausing the issue when a participant comment on it on Service Desk, we made 5 tests (described on the steps to reproduce and expected results section) and what we can conclude of these tests, is that participants are treated like customers by Service Desk SLA, so they will not have the ability to stop the SLA, even if they are agents.

h3. Environment

*Cloud environment
*JIRA Cloud Version: 7.2.0-OD-03-010


h3. Steps to Reproduce
Using the Service Desk UI to open tickets as a customer, execute the following tests:

# As a customer create a ticket through customer portal and add an agent as a participant and comment on the issue as the participant.
# As an agent, add an agent as a participant and comment on the issue of a customer as the participant.
# As an Agent, comment on the issue of a customer without being participant or assignee
# As an agent, comment on the issue of a customer being assigned as participant and assignee at the same time.
# As an agent, comment on the issue of a customer being only the assignee - The SLA stops
# As an agent, comment on the issue internally first then "Share with customer"

h3. Expected Results

In all cases the SLA must stop

h3. Actual Results

# When a customer adds an agent as a participant - if the participant comment on the issue the SLA does not stop
# When an agent is added as participant by another agent - if the participant comment on the issue the SLA does not stop
# When an agent comment on the issue without being a participant or assignee - The SLA stops
# When an agent is added as participant and assignee of the issue - The SLA will not stop
# When the agent is an assignee only - The SLA stops
# When the agent shares an internal comment with customer the - The SLA will not stop.

h3. Notes
No Notes

h3.Workaround
There is no workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: SLA does not pause when commenting on the issue as participant

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the only option for the Issue Collector is to use a default reporter whenever creating issues through the form if the user doesn't exist on the instance. This essentially only allows a one-way feedback system where administrators are unable to easily respond to the feedback.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow as an option the ability to create a Service Desk Customer account whenever submitting an issue through a Service Desk Issue Collector. This makes it easy to respond directly to the customer within the application to provide a response to their feedback.
fields.summary: Allow the option for a JSD Issue Collector to Create a Customer for New Submissions

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor logs dangerous use of multiple connections warnings for JIRA Service Desk mail processor

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk 3.1
* Postgres 9.3, 9.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a Service Desk Mail Channel
# Wait for it to try to process the mail box to create tickets from email

There are no warnings about dangerous use of multiple connections.
